articles.author: RUSS BYNUM, TERRY SPENCER and TRISHA AHMED
articles.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — A masked white man fatally shot three Black people inside a Jacksonville, Florida, Dollar General store in a predominately African-American neighborhood on Saturday, in an attack where he used a gun painted with a swastika, officials said.
articles.title: A white man fatally shoots 3 Black people at a Florida store in a hate crime, then kills himself

articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — A brush fire burned 10 acres (4 hectares) on Saturday and prompted Maui authorities to evacuate residents from a neighborhood of Lahaina, just a few miles from the site recently ravaged by blazes, before firefighters brought it under control.
articles.title: Firefighters douse Maui brush fire that prompted evacuations near site of deadly Lahaina blaze

articles.author: JENNIFER McDERMOTT, BERNARD CONDON and MICHAEL BIESECKER
articles.description: In the first moments of the Maui fires, when high winds brought down power poles, slapping electrified wires to the dry grass below, there was a reason the flames erupted all at once in long, neat rows -- those wires were bare, uninsulated metal that could spark on contact.
articles.title: Bare electrical wire and leaning poles on Maui were possible cause of deadly fires

articles.author: AARON MORRISON and AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Thousands converged Saturday on the National Mall for the 60th anniversary of Rev.
articles.title: Thousands converge on National Mall to mark the March on Washington’s 60th anniversary

articles.author: EVENS SANON
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — A powerful gang opened fire Saturday on a large group of parishioners led by a pastor as they marched through a community armed with machetes to rid the area of gang members.
articles.title: A gang in Haiti opens fire on a crowd of parishioners trying to rid the community of criminals

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: FUTABA, Japan (AP) — For the wrecked Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant, managing the ever-growing volume of radioactive wastewater held in more than 1,000 tanks has been a safety risk and a burden since the meltdown in March 2011.
articles.title: At Fukushima Daiichi, decommissioning the nuclear plant is far more challenging than water release

articles.author: FARAI MUTSAKA and GERALD IMRAY
articles.description: HARARE, Zimbabwe (AP) — Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa was re-elected for a second and final five-year term late Saturday in results announced much earlier than expected following another troubled vote in the southern African country with a history of violent and disputed elections.
articles.title: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa wins re-election after troubled vote, officials say

articles.author: TERRY SPENCER
articles.description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) — Forecasters are warning of possible flash flooding and landslides across the eastern Yucatan peninsula and western Cuba, and Florida braced for a possible hurricane by midweek, as a weather system off the coast of Mexico was expected to become a tropical storm by Sunday, the U.S.
articles.title: Much of Florida under state of emergency as possible tropical storm forms in Gulf of Mexico

articles.author: GRAHAM DUNBAR and JOSEPH WILSON
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — FIFA suspended Spanish soccer federation president Luis Rubiales on Saturday while its disciplinary committee investigates his conduct at the Women’s World Cup final, which included kissing player Jenni Hermoso on the lips after Spain's victory.
articles.title: FIFA suspends Spain soccer federation president Luis Rubiales for 90 days after World Cup win kiss

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: The Wagner Group's presence extends from the ancient battlegrounds of Syria to the deserts of sub-Saharan Africa, projecting the Kremlin's global influence with mercenaries accused of using brutal force and profiting from seized mineral riches.
articles.title: Russia's Wagner mercenaries face uncertainty after the presumed death of their leader in plane crash
